channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023070155
item.description:
Report E-2023070155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading a trailer box of drums warehousemen noticed a puddle of material under a drum upon closer inspection a neighboring ring top drum with a long bolt punctured the drum of Hi-LO (flammables liquids n.o.s) near the top of the drum. the leaking drum was put into an overpack and the mess cleanup up in house. No material leaked out of the trailer as an inspection of the trailer underbody and property was performed.

item.title: Report E-2023070206
item.description:
Report E-2023070206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: KOKOMO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKO experienced a UN1760 Eggs So Clean pH Booster release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 10' x 50' area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a trailer wall hook puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas along with citric acid to neutralize the material. The damaged tote was then cup up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2023070084

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08

  • State: IN

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the seal on the one poly 15 gallon drum of wheel cleaner (un1760) was defective and had released 2 cups of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070083
item.description:
Report E-2023070083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one large forklift battery (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 cup of acid . The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was damaged at the end of the belt fell off and caused to leaked out . DescribePack: the hole was on the bottom of the jerrican. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: clean up the spill, as well as the neutralizing powder that I sprinkled on the puddle, and the small whisk broom and dust pan that were used.
